Package AI31

Class UserPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • AI31.UserPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AI31Constants, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class UserPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, AI31Constants
    Author:
    dykim This panel is the base of the components. It takes care of updating each component with the numbers nescessary for the component.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • LABEL_SIZE

        protected static final java.awt.Dimension LABEL_SIZE
        The size of all JTextFields in the first page. This is so that when I add them, they don't auto shrink to a tiny size.

      • SMALL_LABEL_SIZE

        protected static final java.awt.Dimension SMALL_LABEL_SIZE
        The size of some of the smaller components.

      • LABEL_INSETS

        protected static final java.awt.Insets LABEL_INSETS
        Some random Insets dimension. It doesn't do anything at all - its there for the sake of being there.

      • changeStatus

        protected void changeStatus​(int object,
                            boolean status)
        Used to set the enabled/disabled settings of verying important components.
        Parameters:
        object - - the number of the object you want to change enable/disable settings for Object numbers:
        0 for nextTurnButton,
        -1 for finishRoundButton,
        -2 for startRoundButton,
        -3 for speedBox,
        -4 for displayLivesLostBox,
        -5 for startGameButton,
        -6 for gameModeOptions,
        -7 for showPreviousButton, and
        -8 for playArea
        status - - whether you want the specified object enabled (true) or disabled (false)
